title: Push Notifications On & Off
custom_preconds:
Given we have logged into a valid MLBAM account 
And we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the toggle to the right of 'Push Alerts'
custom_expected: Then 'Push Alerts' can be toggled On & Off

title: Email Notifications On & Off
custom_preconds:
Given we have logged into a valid MLBAM account
And we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the toggle to the right of 'Email'
custom_expected: Then 'Email Alerts' can be toggled On & Off

title: Connect In a Facebook account
custom_preconds:
Given we have logged into a valid MLBAM account 
And we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the 'Connect' button to the right of Facebook
custom_expected: Then we will be prompted to log In to Facebook and authorize MLB.com

title: Connect Out of a Facebook account
custom_preconds:
Given we have logged into a valid MLBAM account 
And we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
And we are connected to Facebook
custom_steps: When we select 'disconnect' to the right of the Facebook
custom_expected: The we are no longer connected with Facebook and button will change to 'connect'

title: Toggle List in Search On & Off
custom_preconds:
Given we have logged into a valid MLBAM account 
And we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the toggle to the right of 'List in Search'
custom_expected: Then 'List in Search' can be toggled On & Off

title: Sign Out of an MLB.com account
custom_preconds:
Given we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the large 'Sign Out' button
custom_expected:
Then we will be signed out of our MLB.com account
And we will be brought to the MLB.com Login Screen

title: Access the How To Play screen
custom_preconds:
Given we have tapped the gear on the top left of the User Profile screen
And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the 'How To Play' button
custom_expected:
Then we will be taken to the 'How To Play' web view
And the text should be clear
And the text should not contain any spelling errors
And the text should not contain and grammatical errors
And there will be ‘Back' button in the upper left of the nav that will take the user back to the Settings menu

custom_expected:

custom_preconds:

And we are on the Settings screen
custom_steps: When we tap on the 'Privacy Policy' button
custom_expected:

title: Email Notifications defaults to Off when Push Notifications are On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has Head to Head installed
AND the Push Notifications are enabled in Settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user looks at the Email Alert setting
custom_expected:
THEN the Email Alert setting will be set to Off
AND the user will be unable to turn them ON as long as Push Alerts are On (Read-Only)

title: Turning off Push Alerts automatically sets Email Alerts to On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has Head to Head installed
AND has Push Alerts enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN the user goes to Settings
AND sets Push Alerts to OFF
custom_expected: THEN Email Alerts will become set to ON

title: Turning off Email Alerts prompts user
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed Head to Head
AND has disabled Push Notifications
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to disable Email Alerts from Settings
custom_expected:
THEN they will receive the following message:
> Warning
> MLB.com strongly recommends enabling either Push Alerts or Email Alerts to optimize your Head to Head Challenge experience. Disabling both will require you to manually check for new challenges, draft and scoring updates and may reduce your quality of Gameplay.
> Cancel | Disable

AND pressing Disable sets Email Alerts to OFF
AND pressing Cancel leaves Email Alerts turned ON
